text:
> apparently gcc 5 doesn’t like llvm 11
Wow, it was actually a miscompilation?!  It’s _never_ a miscompilation!  Dang Curtis, I think you should get an award or something.

text: it's the second time in a few days we bumped into some problems with GCC 5: <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/issues/2492> I was getting crazy with that one, but luckily the upstream library mentions it as a known issue in the documentation

elements.text: it's the second time in a few days we bumped into some problems with GCC 5:
I was getting crazy with that one, but luckily the upstream library mentions it as a known issue in the documentation

text:
> what binary deps are missing now?  maybe none?
Maybe some tweaks to OpenBLAS? A newer version of OpenBLAS is needed when compiling from source on Big Sur so we need a BB version to match. I already have an initial release but there are some issues to work through.

Mainly I need to run the test suite again and see what's the next most breaking thing.

elements.text: what binary deps are missing now?  maybe none?

Maybe some tweaks to OpenBLAS? A newer version of OpenBLAS is needed when compiling from source on Big Sur so we need a BB version to match. I already have an initial release but there are some issues to work through.

Mainly I need to run the test suite again and see what's the next most breaking thing.

text: I would like to mass-rebuild everything and see if the `ldid`-signed binaries no longer require the user to use `codesign` on all the libraries when loading Julia

elements.text: I would like to mass-rebuild everything and see if the
ldid
-signed binaries no longer require the user to use
codesign
on all the libraries when loading Julia
(by “everything” I mean all Julia deps)
